background: A store owner is looking to maximize profit by selling carrots and cucumbers with known costs and profits while adhering to budget constraints.

parameters.definition: Monthly budget for carrots and cucumbers
Estimated maximum ratio of cucumbers sold to carrots sold
Minimum number of carrots sold per month
Maximum number of carrots sold per month

constraints.description: The number of carrots sold must be an integer.
constraints.code:
# Modify the variable CarrotsSold to enforce integrality
CarrotsSold.vtype = gp.GRB.INTEGER

constraints.description: The number of cucumbers sold is an integer.
constraints.code:
# Change the variable type to integer to ensure CucumbersSold is an integer
CucumbersSold.vtype = gp.GRB.INTEGER

constraints.description: The number of carrots sold must be greater than or equal to zero (non-negative).
constraints.code: # Since the variable "CarrotsSold" is already coded as non-negative (continuous variables in gurobipy are non-negative by default), no additional constraint is needed.

constraints.description: The number of cucumbers sold must be non-negative.
constraints.code:
# The variable "CucumbersSold" is already defined as non-negative due to its default non-negativity in Gurobi,
# so no constraint code is needed.

constraints.description: The budget constraint to ensure the total cost of carrots and cucumbers sold does not exceed the monthly budget.
constraints.code:
# Add budget constraint
model.addConstr(CostCarrot * CarrotsSold + CostCucumber * CucumbersSold <= Budget, name="budget_constraint")

constraints.description: The number of cucumbers sold must not exceed the estimated ratio of cucumbers to carrots sold times the number of carrots sold.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint ensuring that the number of cucumbers sold does not exceed the ratio times the number of carrots sold
model.addConstr(CucumbersSold <= RatioCucumbersToCarrots * CarrotsSold, name="cucumber_to_carrot_ratio")

constraints.description: Ensure the number of carrots sold meets or exceeds the specified minimum requirement.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint to ensure the number of carrots sold meets or exceeds the specified minimum
model.addConstr(CarrotsSold >= MinCarrotsSold, name="min_carrots_sold")

constraints.description: The number of carrots sold should not exceed the maximum allowed number of carrots sold.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint to ensure the number of carrots sold does not exceed the maximum allowed
model.addConstr(CarrotsSold <= MaxCarrotsSold, name="max_carrots_sold_constraint")

constraints.description: Auxiliary constraint ensuring the number of carrots sold is within the specified minimum and maximum bounds.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint for bounding the number of carrots sold
model.addConstr(MinCarrotsSold <= CarrotsSold, name="min_carrots_sold")
model.addConstr(CarrotsSold <= MaxCarrotsSold, name="max_carrots_sold")

constraints.description: Auxiliary constraint to enforce the cucumbers-to-carrots ratio does not exceed the limit.
constraints.code:
# Add the cucumbers-to-carrots ratio constraint
model.addConstr(CucumbersSold <= RatioCucumbersToCarrots * CarrotsSold, name="cucumber_to_carrot_ratio")

constraints.description: Ensure the total cost of carrots and cucumbers does not exceed the budget.
constraints.code:
# Add budget constraint for carrots and cucumbers
model.addConstr(CarrotsSold * CostCarrot + CucumbersSold * CostCucumber <= Budget, name="budget_constraint")

constraints.description: Ensure the number of cucumbers sold does not exceed the specified ratio relative to the number of carrots sold.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint to ensure the number of cucumbers sold does not exceed the specified ratio of carrots sold
model.addConstr(CucumbersSold <= RatioCucumbersToCarrots * CarrotsSold, name="cucumber_to_carrot_ratio")

constraints.description: Ensure the number of carrots sold is within the allowable range.
constraints.code:
# Add constraint to ensure the number of carrots sold is within the allowable range
model.addConstr(MinCarrotsSold <= CarrotsSold, name="min_carrots_sold")
model.addConstr(CarrotsSold <= MaxCarrotsSold, name="max_carrots_sold")

variables.definition: The number of carrots sold in the store
The number of cucumbers sold in the store

objective.description: Maximize total profit from selling carrots and cucumbers.
objective.code:
# Set objective
model.setObjective(ProfitCarrot * CarrotsSold + ProfitCucumber * CucumbersSold, gp.GRB.MAXIMIZE)
